snippet: Emergency officials said that the submarine posed no risk of leaking radiation because its nuclear fuel and armaments had been removed before the work began.
abstract: Russian nuclear Kursk-type submarine caught fire during repairs in dry dock near Arkhangelsk; emergency officials told Russian news agencies there is no threat of radiation leaking because fuel and armaments were removed before work commenced.
lead_paragraph: Emergency officials said that the submarine posed no risk of leaking radiation because its nuclear fuel and armaments had been removed before the work began.

headline.main: Russian Nuclear Submarine Catches Fire During Repairs
headline.print_headline: Europe; Russia: Fire Aboard Nuclear Submarine
